meanings.definition: To exclude someone from a group or organization by voting against them.
meanings.sent1: The members were blackballing the new applicant from joining their club.
meanings.sent2: The group decided to blackball the proposal, preventing it from moving forward.
meanings.sent3: The idea of blackballing the noisy neighbor from the block party was met with chuckles.
meanings.sent4: Her constant gossiping led to others blackballing her from social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The act of blackballing can create feelings of isolation and exclusion.

meanings.definition: A negative vote or veto used to exclude someone from a group.
meanings.sent1: The blackballing of the candidate was a clear sign of disapproval from the team.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a blackballing can be disheartening for those seeking acceptance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's blackballing of the new dog in the house led to some playful rivalry.
meanings.sent4: The blackballing in the election highlighted the divisions within the community.
meanings.sent5: The power of a single blackballing can sway the group's decision significantly.

meanings.definition: The act of rejecting or ostracizing someone.
meanings.sent1: The blackballing of the student made them feel unwelcome in the class.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the blackballing of a friend can be emotionally challenging.
meanings.sent3: The blackballing of the unpopular team member was seen as a harsh but necessary action.
meanings.sent4: In the world of social media, online blackballing can happen swiftly and without warning.
meanings.sent5: The community's blackballing of the troublemaker aimed to maintain peace and order.
